definition: to work against the clock/to hurry with work to get it done in time
to overtake/to catch up with/to hurry/to rush/to try to catch (the bus etc)/to drive (cattle etc) forward/to drive (sb) away/to avail oneself of (an opportunity)/until

sentences.english: Sheila worked like a dog to complete the book report on time.
sentences.chinese: 席拉爲求準時完成讀書報告而拼命趕工。
蜜蜂嗡嗡叫，忙着去趕工。

sentences.english: Due to a breakdown. The production team played catch up all week.
sentences.chinese: 由於機器故障，生產組整個星期都在拼命趕工。

sentences.english: Sorry I'm so out of it, had to pull an all-nighter last night!
sentences.chinese: 對不起，我有點迷迷糊糊，昨晚一夜趕工沒有睡。

definition: to repair in a rush/rush repairs
to bury oneself in work (idiom); to be engrossed in work/to make an all-out effort/up to the neck in work
(of a pendulum) to stop swinging/(of work, production, activities etc) to come to a halt/to be suspended/to be canceled/shutdown/(sports) lockout
to act with urgency/to buy time
to debug/to adjust components during testing/debugging
(saying) to be very scared and on edge
to change shift/the next work shift/to relieve (a workman on the previous shift)/to take over the job
lit. fight minutes, snatch seconds (idiom); a race against time/making every second count
